Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to prove the existence of Congress MLA Anil Upadhyay and his criticism of the party.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the video features Congress MLA Anil Upadhyay without verifying the authenticity of the video or the identity of the person speaking.
Exist alternative explanation: There are alternative explanations provided by Alt News, stating that the name "Anil Upadhyay" is fictitious and has been used in multiple viral videos with false claims.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there is no Congress politician named "Anil Upadhyay" according to the database of contesting political candidates.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the significance of the video by urging users to make it viral and stating that it contains the "complete truth."
Understate: There is no evidence of understatement bias in the claim.
